definition: to inspect/to review/to read/to peruse/to go through/to experience
old variant of 曆|历[li4]/old variant of 歷|历[li4]

sentences.english: We are all a product of our experience.
sentences.chinese: 我们都是我们阅历的产物。

sentences.english: Studying abroad provides an opportunity to broaden your experience and mind.
sentences.chinese: 出国留学是一个增加阅历和拓宽思想的良好机会。

sentences.english: However, O'Sullivan has gone through unimaginable rough Ding.
sentences.chinese: 不过，奥沙利文却阅历了丁俊晖难以想象的坎坷。

sentences.english: Experience. I’m 34 years old, so I have a lot more life experience than your typical 20–year old college student.
sentences.chinese: 我现在34岁，比20岁的大学生多一些生活阅历。

sentences.english: This red building is steeped in history.
sentences.chinese: 这座红色的建筑物有着丰厚的汗青阅历。

sentences.english: But young to mean experience to be light , even more modest to learn too.
sentences.chinese: 但年轻也意味着阅历浅，更要虚心向学。

sentences.english: Reading is something else, an engagement of the imagination with life experience.
sentences.chinese: 阅读需要的是人生阅历和想象能力，缺一不可。

sentences.english: Experienced with mechanical drawing and extrusion die design.
sentences.chinese: 具有机械制图和挤出模具计划阅历。

sentences.english: Referrals my weight loss experience it, LZ.
sentences.chinese: 引荐一下我的减肥阅历吧，LZ。

sentences.english: Enlisted soldier's experience lets I more profound experience army discipline the significance.
sentences.chinese: 学兵地阅历让本人愈加深入地领会到戎行规律地意义。

sentences.english: Wechat business practitioners, experience too much.
sentences.chinese: 微商从业者，阅历了太多。

sentences.english: Therefore, it is difficult to design a flower border without abundant experience.
sentences.chinese: 因此，没有丰富的实践阅历，难以进行花境的设计。

sentences.english: Experience a catastrophe after two people finally mutual defense, fall really love.
sentences.chinese: 阅历过一场浩劫后的两人终于互诉衷情，真心相爱了。

sentences.english: Traveling companions not only enrich the experience of travel, but also make it safer.
sentences.chinese: 游伴不仅丰富旅游阅历，也会让游程更安全。

sentences.english: Our relationships with others help to improve our life experience.
sentences.chinese: 我们与他人的关系会帮助我们增加生活阅历。

sentences.english: WangXin colleagues in my own experience, to soothe red fruits.
sentences.chinese: 同事王炘以本人的亲自阅历来抚慰红果。

definition: to gain first-hand knowledge of sth/to experience for oneself/knowledge/experience/insight
worldly wisdom/the ways of the world/to know how to get on in the world
